reviews.sentence: Location. The hotel is going through a renovation so the restaurant is closed and the parking garage is closed. You have the choice of self park up the street or valet.

Amazing Customer Service. I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Downtown for a conference it has been about 4 years since I have stayed at this particular hotel. The changes that they have made in that time are wonderful. The staff offered top notch customer service from check in to assistance with our needs during our stay every single one of the staff members were friendly smiling courteous and above beyond helpful. Very clean hotel from the lobby to the fitness center and to our room I could not have asked for a better experience. I personally want to commend 3 staff members in particular. Tyla from Housekeeping John from Engineering and Nivea from the Front Desk. Tyla came to our aid at 10 pm on the first night due to a wet spot on our floor. She brought us towels contacted engineering to make sure there was not a leak. She was so friendly so bright cheerful at that time of night joy was emanating from her. She told us she had be back on shift the next day at 3 pm and would check on us. She kept her word. She brought John from Engineering that evening to double check on us. We appreciated both of them coming back to follow up and sharing their outgoing personalities. They were amazing. Nivea at the front desk was super friendly outgoing as well she was helpful took very good care of us including storing our bags after check out not once but twice. She went out of her way to make us feel welcome. well cared for. she is a gem to have welcoming your guests. I can not say enough about these 3 people along with the other staff I had the privilege of interacting with. This is going to be my choice hotel for my annual visits to KC I highly recommend it. Even with renovations going on which I did not even notice but which they made sure you were aware of offered amenities for I would suggest staying here it is only getting better. Well done Crowne Plaza KC Downtown. Thank you for treating me like a superstar.

Comfortable stay professional staff. This is an older hotel in the process of exterior renovations. Hotel staff was very clear about construction noise during the day which was not an issue for us. Smallish slightly dated room but comfortable. I was pleased that we were able to check in early without hassles. The only major issue was lack of onsite parking due to the ongoing construction. The hotel is within a very short walking distance of the KC Convention Center and has a fitness center and a small outdoor pool on the 7th floor. There is a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby as well as a bar which I did not visit. The staff was very professional and courteous were prompt in responding to needing extras for the room pillows and towels and quickly resolved a scheduling issue with our reservation. Housekeeping was surprisingly thorough in tidying up the room during our stay.

Great hotel. The staff here is super friendly and willing to accommodate. This was my first stay at Crowne Plaza and I will definitely consider it next time I am in the area. Some things need to be updated but everything was clean and comfortable.

Nice room hallways were ready for a refresh. Nice enough hotel. Rooms and bedding were good but the hotel seems to be aging poorly and could use a refresh. Molding in the hallways was badly chipped or broken. Restaurant service was pleasant but slow.

Great Location Staff and Service Overshawdowed. As I entered the lobby of this hotel on a Sunday afternoon in July 2016 the first thing that struck me was that the carpeting was badly stained. That coupled with the fact that it is an older hotel and the lighting is dim left me feeling uncomfortable. Our group had signed a contract sight unseen for a 35 day meeting there so I could not have re located if i wanted too. In the end we got great service from the staff a good nights sleep in comfortable beds and a good location. but I could not get past the first impression. I was in a suite and feared that given how soiled the carpet appeared I did not dare chance sitting on the upholstered furniture in my room. I was told by hotel staff that they were planning a renovation in 2years and in the interim planned to do some deep carpet cleaning. If the carpeting were not so obviously soiled I would have given this property a pretty good rating despite it being a little dated.

Great Service Great Views Great Location. I am here in Kansas City for a conference and am totally glad they put me here. I have been to the front desk three times and the service and responsiveness of the staff has been AMAZING. For example minor maintenance issue not affecting my stay in any way I mentioned for a heads up was resolved by lunch. Also the views from this building are ineradicable. Odd number rooms have a much better distance sunset view. Even numbers look into the downtown buildings and the Power Light district. Take your pickFinaly the location has been great. All our events have been at the Kansas City convention center totally walk able. Went out to eat plenty of options and theirs a courtesy van too. Highly recommend this hotel.

We came as a guest for a wedding and will never return. We arrived this past Sat afternoon for a rehearsal dinner and wedding weekend. We received our keys to our first room 2303 got up there opened the door and there was a standing ironing board. unmade bed and bathroom had not been cleaned. We went back down and were given keys to 2313. Got back upstairs and the keys were not working. Front desk came up with only 2 keys they worked and we arrived. This left us little time to get ready for the rehearsal dinner. On the way out we got our 3rd key. On the way home we decided to see the executive lounge and our keys did not work too late to fix so we went back to the front desk in the am to get the keys to work so we could use the executive lounge as we had concierge level rooms. We had breakfast and off we went for the day. At 330pm when we arrived back to our room housekeeping had never cleaned and made up the room so after notifying the front desk I asked for fresh towels and told them to make sure someone from housekeeping came up to clean the room at 5 pm when we left for the wedding waited 20 min and called again this time someone came with towels. I reiterated to the gentleman from housekeeping to clean the room when we have left around 5 pm. We came home from the wedding at 10 pm to an unmade uncleaned room. I called down to the front desk explained again what had happened and told them to have someone come up immediately to clean the room and make the beds waited 15 min and called again. this time she assured us someone was coming. We went down to the lobby and sat there til 1040pm when the rooms were ready for us. We had a 930am flight to catch today and had to be up at 615am. I have stayed in many hotels but this could have been a tv show it was so absurd. In my opinion the hallways and rooms smelled musty with alot of carpet stains and the rooms were in desperate need of refurbishment. I can not complain about the shower the water was hot with great pressure. The tub seemed to drain OK. We have never been to Kansas City but assure you we will try the Mariot the next time. We are IHG rewards members and were clearly disappointed in management. Staffing at the front desk and housekeeping. You could do better.

Overpriced In dire need of updating terrible service. No one was at the front desk at 4 pm to check in. Waited 5 minutes and someone finally wanders out but still does not bother. Starbucks in lobby but line is slow and there are usually 20 people in line. The room was small and in serious need of updating. We paid for an upgraded room 300 and it was small and in need of everything. Beds were uncomfortable. No fan in bathroom and very small. But no plugs for hairdryers etc. by mirror in hallway either. Discolored old grout in tub old carpet tub drain did not work. Room was overpriced in our opinion. The woman who performed our check out was unable to make eye contact and mumbled into her chest. Seemed uninterested in her job. Between check in person and check out person these were probably the worst 2 hotel desk people. Pros there is a nice lobby and easy parking. Wish they had put more effort into the rooms beds and Front Desk. There are plenty of better hotels do not stay here. Stayed at a Holiday Inn the next night for 120 and could not believe how nice it was in comparison.
Great location. Very friendly front desk staff. Tiny bathroom. Could use updating.

Hospitality and service like no other. I had a little issue with my room and they fixed it right away. Everyone was kind and attentive to the guests. Although the hotel is undergoing major renovation they did their best to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Great location downtown in the heart of Kansas City. Parking is too expensive at 29 per night so park across the way using the public parking structure for 8 per night. do not buy anything in the little snack bar near check in. They charge movie theater prices at 3 for a 25 oz bag potato chips 4 for cookies 225 for a small candy bar 3 for a bottle of water etc. The hotel restaurant called the City Bar is overpriced and offers small portions. I tastes like they reheat frozen meals. I could actually taste the freezer burn when I ate the ribs. The calamari was like eating rubber bands dipped in wasabi sauce. The staff was awesome but the prices were teribleDespite the little pricing issues this is still one of the best hotels for the money in Kansas City.
Great location. Room was newly renovated and very nice had a coffee shop in the hotel.
Updated hotel clean and walking distance to power and light. Very friendly staff and went above and beyond to help us out loved it.

Had a great stay. I greatly appreciated the updated decor both in the main lobby and private rooms. The housekeeping staff was very friendly when even just meeting them in the hallway elevator. All was great.

Commitment to customer service. We spent our anniversary at this hotel and had a thoroughly wonderful experience from check in to check out. Roxie at the valet stand was welcoming and enthusaistic. The assistant manager checked us in notifying us of the remodeling currently underway. She apologized the concierage lounge was closed and proceeded to send us a bottle of wine. Ryan the bartender was pleasant and acomodating. He found the perfect balance between attentiveness and respectful distance. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. We enjoyed breakfast and took our servers recommendation for the avocado toast with a perfectly over medium egg with microgrens. Husband ordered the buffet and rated it an A. The food was replaced often offerings were warm plentiful BACON.

Perfect Location. Room was clean and updated. View was great. Location is perfect for those interested in the Power and Light District as it is merely a block away. Hotel staff friendly and accommodating. Valet parking was reasonable. Great bar with very good prices on drinks.
Completely updated beautiful rooms and The Suite awesome idea for a smaller meeting space.

I have been to this hotel another time before and enjoyed my stay. I definitely liked it alot better this time around new room renovations and the lobby had snacks drinks you could buy. Staff was very friendly. Hotel is in a great location to go out and about downtown.

A nice older hotel that has been updated. My bed was comfortable and had good pillows. I had a mini fridge and cofemaker in my room. The bathroom is tiny and I felt like a giant in the shower. The hotel is in a great location downtown.

Great room terrible food. Room was clean updated and very comfortable. Parking was easily accessible and free. We ate dinner at the restaurant at about 930pm. Food was cold and stale. We decided the next morning to give the breakfast buffet a try at 70am. Again food was less than desirable. Of my family of three everyone left full plates at the table. Eggs were a weird runny texture. Bacon was undercoked sausage was overcooked and fruit was not ripe.
